intro: Delissea pluriflora, commonly known as the many-flowered delissea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Delissea pluriflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
